alert.note: Alert for Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:14PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Seneca, northwestern Yates, northwestern Cayuga and western Steuben Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chimney Bluffs State Park to near Phelps to Wayland to 6 miles northwest of Genesee. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hornell, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Penn Yan, Benton, Canisteo, Potter, Wayland, Middlesex and Howard. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 41. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 34 North and 37. Interstate 390 between 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.
